title: Shakespeare's Globe on Screen Antony and Cleopatra (2014)
description:
Shakespeare's Globe on Screen Antony and Cleopatra (2014)
from Opus Arte through Naxxos

Runtime: 163 minutes presented in two parts at act break


Summary

A live performance of the tragedy "Antony and Cleopatra" by William Shakespeare. Set in Roman times, the play deals with Mark Antony's obsessive passion for Egypt's Queen Cleopatra, and how it leads to the tragic downfall of both.

Language note 	"Spoken in Shakespeare's English", with optional English subtitles;


Directed for the stage by    Jonathan Munby
Directed for the screen by   Ian Russell
Creatives

Designer,      Colin Richmond
composer,      Jules Maxwell  
choreographer  Aline David 
fight director Kate Waters  

Eexecutive producers, Dominic Dromgoole, Robert Marshall ; producers, Lotte Buchan, Jessica Lusk.

Cast

Clive Wood,     Marc Antony
Eve Best,       Cleopatra
Jolyon Coy,     Octavius Caesar
James Hayes,     Lepidus
Phil Daniels,   Enobarbus
Sirine Saba,    Charmian
Rosie Hilal.    Octavia

  full cast notes in the credits

My notes.  

  Eve Best is known both for her roles such as Beatrice in Much Ado About Nothing and here as Cleopatra but there is more.  She also directs for the Globe company and appears in BBC historical dramas as well.  For contrast, Jane LaPoitaire portrayed the queen in the BBC series directed by Jonathan Miller.  It is available elsewhere on the net but the Ambrose series is not in my collection.  The story is familair from film and stage such as that written by Bernard Shaw.

I encourage that the original dvds be purchased for libraries so that more may enjoy them as I do.  The subtitles are selectable from your media player.

Notes written  November 8th  2015
